content: I remember the 'Eureka' moment. I leveraged AI tools to build a whole program shell and used Cursor for the backend in just 4 days. It felt like I hacked productivityâ€”going from idea to working app instantly.

I am taking the biggest risk of my life right now. I'm about to drop out of college to work on my ideas. I feel a mix of pure excitement to do what I love, but a deep, gnawing uncertainty and fear. I don't know if it will pay off yet.
My biggest failure was Aercarbon. I spent $40-80 and weeks building it, but when I launched, it stunk. No traction. It reminds me that building isn't enough; people need to want it.

I remember the physics question about the ball and the car. The whole class thought the ball would stay behind, but I knew inertia meant it traveled at 80mph with the car. Being right when everyone else was wrong gave me a massive sense of confidence.
When I went through that breakup, I cried in front of Richard. He didn't try to fix it. He just stayed quiet, listened, and was there. That is what true support feels like.
My perfect peace is waking up at 5:00 AM. The smell of rainy mist, the dew, the light sun. The gym routine releases endorphins that make the rest of the day feel easy.
